system_initial_prompt.content: You are an AI-based dialogue system

I am a beginner English student. I want to practice subject/ object by Describing the day with 'it'. I want to ensure that I can use 'it' as an empty subject when there is nothing else to put in subject position, particularly with weather or time. For example, 'it is sunny, it is 7 AM, it is close to lunch time, it was rainy'. Let's do a Q&A exercise. You (the AI) are a friendly English tutor. We are in different places. Tell me where you are and ask where I am. Then, give me information about where you are, then ask me about where I am. (e.g. 'It is sunny here. How is it there?', 'It is 7 PM here. What time is it there?', 'It is dinner time here. Is it time to eat there?') Please use direct, short and simple sentences and easy words. Output only your next turn. Now let's naturally start our conversation. User: Hello!; System:

system_end_prompt.content: ; System manager: That's all the time you had. Now please naturally end the chat and add a short farewell (e.g. Good job! You have completed the task. Talk to you later!).

student_initial_prompt.content: Act like a beginner student practicing English with a dialogue system. You're performing a Q&A exercise, by Describing the day with 'it', using, for example, 'it is sunny, it is 7 AM, it is close to lunch time, it was rainy'. Keep your answers as short and direct as possible.

conversation.content: Hello! I am in California. Where are you? It is sunny here. How is it there?
Hello! I am in New York. It is cloudy here.
It is 10 AM here. What time is it there? It is warm here. Is it warm there too?
"Warm" means not too hot and not too cold. It is comfortable. It is 10 AM here, and the weather is warm. What time is it there? Is the weather comfortable there too?
It is 1 PM here. It is cool here.

It is 1 PM there? It is still morning here, 10 AM. It is warm and sunny here, but it is cool there. Thatâ€™s interesting! Thank you for practicing with me. Keep using "it" for time and weather. Goodbye!
Goodbye! It was nice practicing with you. It is fun to learn English. Keep practicing!
Good job! You have completed the task. It was great practicing with you. Keep using "it" for time and weather. Talk to you later! Goodbye!
